The research is supported by the Foundation for Innovative Research Groups of the National Natural Science Foundation of China (Grant No. 51521003 and NO. 61603112) and the Self-Planned Task (NO. SKLRS201721A) of State Key Laboratory of Robotics and System (HIT).

organization.$: State Key Laboratory of Robotics and System

head.citation-title: Virtual simulation of the artificial satellites based on OpenGL
head.abstracts: Â© Springer International Publishing AG 2017.In order to generate the images of the satellites in outer space, a virtual simulation platform was build up based on Visual C++ and OpenGL API. Take the Sinosat-2 Satellite as an example, which is a failure satellite of China. Its projection model was established using computer-graphics technology. Its kinematics formulas were described using quaternions to avoid singularity. A spinning model was set up to demonstrate its motion in 3D space. The platform could simulate the synthetic images of the satellite and then send them to the virtual serve system through TCP/IP in real time.

coredata.dc:description: In order to generate the images of the satellites in outer space, a virtual simulation platform was build up based on Visual C++ and OpenGL API. Take the Sinosat-2 Satellite as an example, which is a failure satellite of China. Its projection model was established using computer-graphics technology. Its kinematics formulas were described using quaternions to avoid singularity. A spinning model was set up to demonstrate its motion in 3D space. The platform could simulate the synthetic images of the satellite and then send them to the virtual serve system through TCP/IP in real time.
coredata.dc:title: Virtual simulation of the artificial satellites based on OpenGL
